doc.abstracts: In April 2008, Bernhard H. Liese was interviewed on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by Charles Ziegler. During her tenure at the Bank from 1976 to 2002, Mr. Liese worked in the following areas: as an assistant for public health in the office of the vice president, operations policy in 1976. In 1980 he became deputy chief of the population, health, and nutrition department. In 1985 he moved on to become operations adviser and principal tropical disease specialist in the same department. From 1990 to 2000 Mr. Liese was director of the joint health services department, which he made into one of the leading such entities in the United States, launching many innovative programs. In 2000 Mr. Liese became senior adviser on human development in the Africa Region. He retired from the Bank in 2002, although he continued his consulting activities. This transcript concerns the Alma-Ata declaration.
